__e: I don't think they are, not these city bugs.
There weren't such idiots around in my days.
Oh, if we was to screw each other's brains out every now and again,
Well, maybe we're all fools and none of it matters.
First they take our cattle, now you're taking the rest.
That we're all dumb and bad and that's why he let the world be destroyed? That's exactly right, Sister Gretchen.
This is no place for wild beasts.
Now you're at the mercy of the fishes and wild beasts... you, who bragged about your warrior innocence.
She said, "They're not boys, they're savages."
Tom, some of those cows in there are mine.
I mean, besides the rough sex we had up against the sides?
I mean, you know, we're all idiots at some time or another, right?
But you've no place of your own.
If your parents are too fucked-up to do it, then maybe I should.
You and your family are the only ones stupid enough to still be living in this town.
Since then, the beasts have served us.
Now I have heat on me to solve the hospice bombings and the brewery, my boyfriend still has a superhuman target on his back, and beasts are back in our lives.
